posts.name: Konnor/RetroBuzz | 5517AM
posts.cooked: So our gyro is the single axis and we need like a 90 degree cable or a regular one or something. Unless there’s a better way.
Is this an SPI gyro or MXP port? Here is an extension for SPI. Here is one for MXP.

link_counts.title: 1-ft 10-Pin 2.54mm-Pitch Male/Female 10-wire IDC Flat Ribbon Extension, FR-1012M | eBay

posts.name: Ken Pontbriant
posts.cooked:
If you’re referring to the FRC KOP gyro that’s intended to plug into the RIO SPI port, there’s an easy fix. We remove the connector from the rear of the board, install a 2X5 pin header on the top of the board in its place, and make our own cable using the same tools and contacts used for PWM or CAN cables.

We typically mount the gyro on the drive base, parallel to the floor and mount the RIO vertically nearby.
